name: Malignant Hyperthermia Susceptibility with Atypical Presentation
chief_complaint: Severe muscle rigidity and high fever after anesthesia induction
treatment: Immediate discontinuation of triggering agents (volatile anesthetics/succinylcholine)
IV dantrolene sodium (2.5 mg/kg bolus, repeat as needed)
Correct metabolic acidosis with sodium bicarbonate
Maintain urine output >2 mL/kg/hr with diuresis
prognosis: High mortality (15-20%) if not treated within 20 minutes; excellent recovery with prompt treatment
description: Life-threatening pharmacogenetic disorder of skeletal muscle calcium regulation triggered by certain anesthetic agents. This atypical presentation includes delayed onset (45 minutes post-induction) and absence of classic masseter spasm. Caused by RYR1 or CACNA1S gene mutations.
risk_factors: Family history of MH or anesthesia complications
multiple_choice: Malignant Hyperthermia Susceptibility with Atypical Presentation
